meanings: [명사] patience, (오랜 고통·어려움에 대한) endurance, [동사] endure, stand, bear, be patient (with), have patience (with)

examples.korean: You have to persevere with difficult students. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 힘든 학생들에 대해서는 인내심을 가져야 합니다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: You have to persevere with difficult students. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: In his job, patience is an invaluable asset. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그가 하는 일에서는 인내가 귀중한 자산이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: In his job, patience is an invaluable asset. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: It takes time and patience to photograph wildlife. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 야생 동물 촬영에는 시간과 인내력이 필요하다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: It takes time and patience to photograph wildlife. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Everyone admired her patience and unfailing good humour. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 모두가 그녀의 인내심과 변함없는 쾌활함에 감탄했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Everyone admired her patience and unfailing good humour. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: His constant complaints were straining our patience. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그의 끊임없는 불평에 우리의 인내심이 한계에 이르고 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: His constant complaints were straining our patience. Add to Wordbook
